channel.title: When i try to trade an npc my server loses connection
channel.description:
ok somebody help. if i try to trade an npc, the person who traded the npc loses connection and goes back to the last saved spot, whether or not they are set up as a shop.
its a 317 delta, thanks

item.title: When i try to trade an npc my server loses connection
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

this is the shop code

none are custom items, only 3 items, a bucket, hammer and a rune essence. umm its just that one character, other clients freezes if i try it on another it does the same thing, a white message pops up saying
“connection lost
please wait - attempting to reestablish” then another pops up and it says
“loading - please wait”
and then u pop up at your last saved spot.

thanks guys. and o i did not find the Gorkas compiler

Read full topic

item.title: When i try to trade an npc my server loses connection
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

This is easy. Npcs are unfortunitly Unusable this what u must do. You must 1. get Gorkas compiler and compile and this will show any thing that can possibly lose connection ect misect. Then you can look at something related to npc or npc walk key word ++. If theres nothing or you don find the compiler as it is indeed hard to reach nowadays, i personally havent heard of it its been a good 5 years. Give me a call at fuck you

…okay?

item.title: When i try to trade an npc my server loses connection
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Jc22493:

I think your shop contains too many items.

Yeah, either that or you have an item in your shop that isn’t coded correctly in your client, like if you have a certain custom item that was coded wrong in the shop, that could do it.

item.title: When i try to trade an npc my server loses connection
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[quote=“jwags, post:3, topic:413181”]it does liek the wanneshop thing?

else if (NPCID == 2577) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 76; }

and there is A SHOP 76 IN SHOPS.CFG[/quote]

Well is it your SERVER that disconnects? or you client?

Try it again, if your client freezes then the problem could be very easy to fix.

Read full topic
